name: First and Last Letter's the Same Quiz | Humanities | 20 Questions

questions.text:
First, to note, the hints will only show a number and a letter.  The number is how many letters there are, and the letter is the first letter.

What is a type of snake?  Eight letters, first and last letter is A.
questions.explanation:
Anaconda.

	The anaconda is a huge aquatic boa that lives in swamps.  The average size for the anaconda is 50 to 60 feet, although some people claim they grow much larger, up to 150 feet in length.  Maybe think this is impossible, and there is a large controversy over the matter.  Some anacondas can weigh half a ton!

questions.text: What is a little snippet of information?  Five letters, first and last letter is B.
questions.explanation:
Blurb.

	Blurbs can be found everywhere.  Blurbs are little pieces of info that don't usually even make a whole paragraph.  Blurbs are commonly found on the back of books, a short summary of the book.

questions.text: What is it called when something is funny?  Five letters, first and last letter is C.
questions.explanation:
Comic & Comedic.

	Comics are also magazines with pictures and blurbs to form a story.  Comedians are also known as comics.  Most newspapers have comics in them, especially on Sundays.

questions.text: What is to ask insistingly for something?  Six letters, first and last letter is D.
questions.explanation:
Demand.

	To demand something is to want it and force someone to get it for you.  Sometimes, games and other products are in demand, because stores run out with their supply and many people still want it.  This is called supply and demand.

questions.text: What is a noun meaning the act of spying?  Nine letters, first and last letter is E.
questions.explanation:
Espionage.

	Usually, espionage is when someone is sent out to spy on a rival.  Most often, the rival is another company, and the spy is sent out to learn the trade secrets to better the company.

questions.text: What are soft pieces of wool?  Five letters, first and last letter is F.
questions.explanation:
Fluff.

	Fluff can mean either wool or hair.  Fluff can also be called fuzz.  Fluff is also a verb meaning to do something badly.

questions.text: What is a word that means eating grass?  Seven letters, first and last letter is G.
questions.explanation:
Grazing.

	Many farmers let their livestock out in order to graze on grassy pastures.  Grazing is a great way to feed your animals cheaply.  You don't have to feed them artificial feed or hay, but sometimes it can lead to strays running away.

questions.text: What means wellness?  Six letters, first and last letter is H.
questions.explanation:
Health.

	If you go to the doctor, you are usually getting a check up on your health.  Health can also be paired with nutrition, because eating the right foods can lead to a healthy diet.

questions.text: We skip I and J and go onto K.  Which of these is a type of water vessel?  Five letters, first and last letter is K.
questions.explanation:
Kayak.

	Kayaks are small canoes made by Inuit.  They were usually covered with sealskins.  Kayaks have very small openings for the canoeist to sit in.

questions.text: Which of these is a sticker that shows what something is?  Five letters, first and last letter is L.
questions.explanation:
Label.

	Labels are commonly found on supermarket goods.  Labels do exactly what the word suggests: they label things so you know what they are.  Label can also be a verb, meaning to put a sticker on something.

questions.text: What is a polite way to greet a woman?  Five letters, first and last letter is M.
questions.explanation:
Madam & Ma'am & Maam & Mam.

	It is most polite to call a woman Madam, just as you call a man Sir.  Many parents teach their children always to say Yes Sir and Yes Madam.

questions.text: What would you use to wipe your mouth?  Six letters, first and last letter is N.
questions.explanation:
Napkin.

	Napkins are most often used at picnics and such, and are used to clean your hands and mouth while eating.  Many restaurants use paper napkins during lunchtime, but during dinner time they use fabric napkins.  It is common table manners to keep your napkin under the table on your lap at all times.

questions.text: What is a kind of herb?  Seven letters, first and last letter is O.
questions.explanation:
Oregano.

	Oregano is a spicy herb that is used in cooking.  The most common way to use oregano is dried and crushed.  You can buy oregano at any supermarket.  Oregano can also be used fresh, and gives the dish a much stronger flavor, so using less is better.

questions.text: What is a noun that means being a prime minister?  Eleven letters, first and last letter is P.
questions.explanation:
Premiership.

	A premiership is the time someone is a prime minister.  The prime minister is known as a premier, and premiership is the act of being the prime minister.

questions.text: We skip Q and go onto R.  What is someone who participates in a marathon?  Five or six letters, first and last letter is R.
questions.explanation:
Runner & Racer.

	People who run in a race are known as both runners and racers.  Many marathons are simply running, but some, like a triathlon, involve much more, like swimming and bicycling.

questions.text: What is a nervous strain?  Six letters, first and last letter is S.
questions.explanation:
Stress.

	Stress can mean several things.  It can mean nervous strain, and can also cause depression and anxiety.  It can also mean to force, or pressure someone or something into something.  It can also mean to emphasize.

questions.text: What is a circle with rings around it you try to hit with sharp objects?  Six letters, first and last letter is T.
questions.explanation:
Target.

	Targets are also known as bullseyes.  Targets are practice circles you throw or shoot things at to try to hit the center.  Darts is a game that uses a target, and you throw sharp objects at it to stick and get points.

questions.text: We skip both U and V and go to W.  What is a pane you can see through?  Six letters, first and last letter is W.
questions.explanation:
Window.

	Windows can be double or single paned.  Most houses have windows.  Windows are like mirrors, but you can see through them.  Some windows can be tinted so you can see out but nobody can see in.

questions.text: What does it mean to make a photocopy?  Five letters, first and last letter is X.
questions.explanation:
Xerox.

	A Xerox is a trademark for a type of photocopier.  However, the term can also be used as the act of photocopying using one of these machines, and as the item that has been photocopied using one of these machines.

questions.text: Our final letter is Y, so we will not do Z.  What is the day before today?  Nine letters, first and last letter is Y.
questions.explanation:
Yesterday.

	We use the word yesterday to talk about what happened one day before.  Sometimes we say yesteryear, which simply means it was in the past, sometimes years before.  When something has happened two days ago, we say the day before yesterday.
